comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: "Edward Mandell House (July 26, 1858 – March 28, 1938) was a renowned American diplomat, politician, and presidential advisor. Commonly known by the title of Colonel House, although he had no military experience, he had enormous personal influence with U.S. President Woodrow Wilson as his foreign policy advisor throughout World War I." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_M._House See also Though the dates on the negative are 2/5/17, this is clearly from the same session as another dated 12/24/15. see also

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: On December 29, 1915 there was a report in the New-York tribune about a trip of House, Whitlock and Boy-Ed (all on photos nearby) on the same boat to Europe, see chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1915-12-29/ed-...

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: artolog and B-59: Thanks for the additional information on House. We will add more info to this and the other photos of him in the series.
